attributes.title: RUNDAY
attributes.descriptionHtml:
# RUNDAY - Monday Trail Run

RUNDAY is our signature Monday evening trail run at Redwood Regional Park, designed to kick off your week with energy and community.

# About This Run

Every Monday, rain or shine, we gather at Skyline Gate for an evening of trail running through the beautiful redwoods. This run has been a Bay Bandits tradition since the beginning!

# What Makes RUNDAY Special

  • Three pace options to fit everyone‚Äôs goals
  • Consistent schedule - same time, same place every week
  • Beautiful location in the heart of the East Bay hills
  • Post-run community time to connect with fellow runners

# Run Options

We offer three distinct groups:

# üèÉ Longer Run (7-9 miles)

The perfect mid-week training run. We head out early and cover more ground at a moderate effort. Great for marathon and ultra training!

  • Distance: 7-9 miles
  • Elevation: 1200-2000 ft
  • Pace: Easy to Moderate
  • Start: 6:00 PM sharp

# üë• Social Run (3-5 miles)

Our most popular option! A relaxed, conversational pace where making friends is just as important as the miles.

  • Distance: 3-5 miles
  • Elevation: 600-1000 ft
  • Pace: Very Easy (talking pace)
  • Start: 6:15 PM

# üí™ Shorter Run (6-8 miles)

A solid workout without the extended time commitment. Good effort with regular regroups.

  • Distance: 6-8 miles
  • Elevation: 1000-1600 ft
  • Pace: Easy to Moderate
  • Start: 6:15 PM

# Location & Parking

Meeting Point: Skyline Gate Staging Area Address: 8490 Skyline Blvd, Oakland, CA 94611

Parking

Parking fills up fast! Arrive 15 minutes early to find a spot and meet your group leaders.

Parking Tips:

  • Free parking available in the main lot
  • Additional street parking on Skyline Blvd
  • Carpooling encouraged!

# What to Bring

Essential gear for RUNDAY:

Item Why You Need It
Headlamp Gets dark fast, especially in fall/winter
Water No water fountains on trail
Trail shoes Better grip on technical terrain
Layers Temperature drops after sunset

First Timer?

Email us or message on Strava before coming. We‚Äôll make sure someone greets you and helps you find the right pace group!

# Trail Conditions

The trails at Redwood are generally well-maintained but can vary by season:

  • Summer (Jun-Sep): Dry and dusty, watch for poison oak
  • Fall (Oct-Nov): Perfect conditions!
  • Winter (Dec-Mar): Muddy after rain, bring trail shoes with good grip
  • Spring (Apr-May): Beautiful wildflowers, some muddy sections

# Connect on Strava

Each run option has its own Strava group event. Join them to:

  • See the planned route
  • Track your stats
  • Connect with other participants
  • View post-run photos

View all RUNDAY events on Strava ‚Üí

‚ÄúRUNDAY is the highlight of my week. Amazing trails, great people, and the perfect way to start the week!‚Äù - Regular Bandit

attributes.name: Bay Bandits
attributes.descriptionHtml:
# About Bay Bandits

The Bay Bandits is a trail running community based in the San Francisco Bay Area, dedicated to bringing runners together for weekly trail adventures.

# Our Mission

We believe in:

  • Making trail running accessible to everyone
  • Building a supportive community
  • Exploring the beautiful trails of the Bay Area
  • Having fun while staying fit

# Weekly Runs

We organize regular group runs throughout the week, with options for all fitness levels:

No-Drop Policy

All our runs follow a no-drop policy, meaning no one gets left behind. We regroup at key points to keep everyone together.

# What to Expect

  • Varied terrain: From easy fire roads to technical single track
  • Different paces: Options for social runners and those looking for a workout
  • Friendly atmosphere: Welcoming to runners of all backgrounds
  • Post-run hangouts: Optional socializing after the run

Trail Conditions

Always check the latest trail conditions before heading out. Trails can be muddy after rain!

# Getting Started

New to trail running? No problem! Here‚Äôs how to join:

  1. Check out our schedule on this site
  2. Show up at the meeting location 15 minutes early
  3. Introduce yourself to the run leaders
  4. Choose a pace group that fits your level
  5. Have fun!

# Community Values

const ourValues = {
  inclusive: true,
  supportive: true,
  funFocused: true,
  trailsFirst: true
};

We strive to create an environment where everyone feels welcome, regardless of pace or experience level.

# Connect With Us

  • Strava Club: Join us on Strava to see routes and connect with members
  • Instagram: @baybandits for photos and updates
  • Website: bandits.run

Stay Updated

Follow us on social media for last-minute trail condition updates and schedule changes!
